metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1000845 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
** REJECT **  DO NOT USE THIS CANDIDATE NUMBER.  ConsultID: CVE-2017-6519. Reason: This candidate is a duplicate of CVE-2017-6519.  Notes: All CVE users should reference CVE-2017-6519 instead of this candidate.  All references and descriptions in this candidate have been removed to prevent accidental usage.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000845` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

avahi-autoipd - 0.6.32~rc+dfsg-1ubuntu2.3
avahi-daemon - 0.6.32~rc+dfsg-1ubuntu2.3
avahi-discover - 0.6.32~rc+dfsg-1ubuntu2.3
avahi-dnsconfd - 0.6.32~rc+dfsg-1ubuntu2.3
avahi-ui-utils - 0.6.32~rc+dfsg-1ubuntu2.3
avahi-utils - 0.6.32~rc+dfsg-1ubuntu2.3
libavahi-client3 - 0.6.32~rc+dfsg-1ubuntu2.3
libavahi-common-data - 0.6.32~rc+dfsg-1ubuntu2.3
libavahi-common3 - 0.6.32~rc+dfsg-1ubuntu2.3
libavahi-compat-libdnssd1 - 0.6.32~rc+dfsg-1ubuntu2.3
libavahi-core7 - 0.6.32~rc+dfsg-1ubuntu2.3
libavahi-glib1 - 0.6.32~rc+dfsg-1ubuntu2.3
libavahi-gobject0 - 0.6.32~rc+dfsg-1ubuntu2.3
libavahi-qt4-1 - 0.6.32~rc+dfsg-1ubuntu2.3
libavahi-ui-gtk3-0 - 0.6.32~rc+dfsg-1ubuntu2.3
libavahi-ui0 - 0.6.32~rc+dfsg-1ubuntu2.3
python-avahi - 0.6.32~rc+dfsg-1ubuntu2.3
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This is a dupe of CVE-2017-6519 The CVE number is the commit was truncated, so is wrong

criterions.comment: avahi package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.6.32~rc+dfsg-1ubuntu2.3').
